overview:
Tyler is a software engineer with a broad range of expertise building web applications for businesses.

His expertise with understanding business concerns and modeling them as software objects is matched only by his enthusiasm for applying web 2.0 business intelligence to increase the odds for entrepreneurs in small business and sustainability enterprises.

In 2000 Tyler developed the data model and data infrastructure for a first-generation CMS to enable Charles Schwab & Co to launch online promotions.

He has been an instrumental member of a number of small teams and has worn many hats as an IT consultant, developing high-end custom business software for corporations such as Genentech, Boston Scientific, SEIU, and Conceptus.

At CafePress.com he helped the business to expand through its growth phase by designing new multimedia storage software, a core business concern, and by developing the company’s first custom traffic analysis software.

At Bookrenter.com he was part of the initial phases of re-developing the company’s pricing algorithm management software to enable robust and precise controls and measurement of product performance.
